Reviews.Title: “'Okay' hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnePsychLynne
Reviews.Content: This was an 'okay' hotel. It was clean, had a microwave and refrigerator and a continental breakfast that included coffee, toast, mini donuts, Twinkies, raisin bran cereal, frosted flakes cereal, milk, and an orange juice drink (like Sunny D or Tang) however there were only two small tables to eat at so you really had to take everything back to your room to eat. The beds were comfortable. It was VERY convenient to all of the Disney parks and was very affordable. I say it was average because there were a few times I didn't feel completely safe (because of some of the individuals staying there). I realise this isn't really the hotel's fault but it is simply my observation. I stayed with my two children, ages 16 and 13, but I probably would not stay there again unless my husband was with me (and I am used to taking care of myself). But I would definitely stay again if he was there.

Reviews.Title: “I tried but couldnt stay here......”
Reviews.Author: Mystery_Traveler_0
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip to Disney and wound up having to switch around some dated and found ourselves without accommodations at our favorite place based off the reviews we gave this one a shot. A shot is what I felt I needed after being in this place! My first tip should have been when I called and asked about the property, they asked what type of hotel I was used staying at, and I gave them an example of another low cost facility we frequent and they were like "oh". Oh? Seems that the other place they considered a higher grade than their property "???" Ok I took the chance and when I pulled up it was weathered and needing some sprucing up but I'm trying to be positive! We get to our 1st room located on the ground floor and the smell of mold and mildew was pretty bad but hey it's Florida it might just need to be aired out (still trying to be positive) sat down and noticed the dresser had 3 drawers of one color and one different color and handle odd but hey I can deal with it. Go to the bathroom and there is mold growing in the corner that was over a half inch in height! I turned around and left my wife has to go so she is going to take a chance well there was live roaches in the tub (yeah plural) and there was some other little round looking bugs on the toilet paper. We explained the situation the front and they gave us a room on the second floor. Room #2 Looked alot better but still smelled moldy just not nearly as bad but bad enough we all started to get a headache. Oh and did I mention more bugs? The elevator smelled so strong of grease and hydraulic fluids that by the second ride down we all had a burning in the back of our throats that lasted even after we left the property. The front desk was accommodating and refunded my money when I explained about what we had found. They did not seem the least bit surprised they just were like ok not even we will look into it or whatever. Now the kicker is I find out later that my DD would not even bring in her beloved bear due the conditions of the room she was afraid of what might happen to it. Wow a kid is will stay because they have to but would not put their stuffed animal through staying there for fear of it getting hurt. If I had know this when we at room #1 I would have walked away without even asking about another room my family and their health is worth more than any good deal on a room. As a side note due to the lack of a room, I wound up visiting 17 hotels in Orlando some good some bad and will be adding reviews to some of those soon.

Reviews.Title: “Better to go with something else”
Reviews.Author: Tyler B
Reviews.Content: The inside of the rooms is decent. Nothing special, other than the rainbow-colored Disney themed comforters on the beds. The hotel advertises free WiFi, but it's very slow and has very limited range. I asked about why it was slow and was given the access to another hotel's wireless network as a solution. Even with the discounted rates for booking early, you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT DEAL!”
Reviews.Author: r_j_scanlon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay here. We stay in this area a lot including Disney Vacation club Resorts. This is not the Grand Floridian so don't expect to be pampered like it is. It is an older, clean, quiet motel a couple of miles from Disney. We never ate there or used the pool because we had other plans. We paid $40 a night for a mini suite with a king size bed and were quite pleased with it. We did see a geico in the room once. No surprise since it is Florida. My cousin just bought a new house a few miles from there for over $700,000 and we saw a geico in that also. The only issue with noise was a couple of little kids outside early one morning who were obviously excited to be going to the parks. Again, no surprise since this is what kids are supposed to do. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “" nice spot !"”
Reviews.Author: Nonesuch60827
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for five nights with 2 members of my family...the rooms were ok...my daughter love the place compared to " key motel" nearby...it's close to everything, but major drawback,it's hard to find when driving on highway 192...the staff very frindely...my mom stayed the entire six days there while i went to the theme parks with my daughter...if I'm in the area I'll stay again....there are a few draw back, the room that we had requested was "no smoking"...when we checked in, it was filthy filled with tobaco smoke...when we complaint, they quickly change the room...the manager even came to the room to make sure everything was ok...the breakfast....the orange juice was just sugar flavored water,not real juice...bread & butter,plus tea available...when i was there i didn't see too many people in the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot In Orlando For The Theme Parks, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent across America motorbike ride with my 17 yo son. The Magic Castle Inn is in a great position - 10 minutes or so from the major Orlando parks, close to the freeway and surrounded by restaurants, convenience stores, etc. It was the perfect place in and out of Orlando. Reception staff were very friendly and efficient (and I fell a little in love with the beautiful, beautiful brunette receptionist!). Rooms were basic, but very clean and tidy. Free WIFI and breakfast make the value just about impossible to beat. Has a nice pool (bit cold to go swimming even for us tough Australians). Sure, some things are a little old but it's a fantastic value hotel and well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MaverickRome
Reviews.Content: Price for the period was good. Rooms: they have air cond, fridge (very noisy),microwave. Cleaning is ok for the price,in general could be much much better. Toilet is very modest.they dont have a small haidrier. Breakfast is ridiculous.bad coffee,orange juice from concentrate,biscuits,milk,cereals.served up to 9. You can get to Disney with a bus or 15 minutes by car.same distance for see world. Wireless was very very slOw.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones motel, no suites at all; shabby and run-down.”
Reviews.Author: Mom3girls
Reviews.Content: We chose this place since it was recommended by relatives, and we needed a place for one night between 2 timeshare weeks. I really wanted to like this; not only is it cute, but I believe it's a small, independent place, not a chain. First I'll give the positives: Location: it is right off of 192 in Kissimmee, easy to get back and forth to Disney World; a Walmart very close by; many family-friendly chain restaurants nearby, a Publix, Walgreens and a CVS also close. Price: very budget-friendly. Cleanliness: spotless, not a bug or stray hair in sight (and dh and I always check the matresses first). The matress itself was very comfortable too. Parking: great; right outside our room, and for 2nd floor units, there's an elevator. We didn't use the t.v., although it looked fairly new for a non flat-screen. Lighting in the room was average for hotels; just enough to make you think it's ok until you try to read. Now the negatives: old, shabby and in need of repair, not to mention updating. The "mini-suite" was nothing more than a standard motel room, with two beds switched out for a king-size bed, and a half-wall separating the bed from the sofa in a pathetic attempt to make the room feel more functional; it did nothing but make it tinier than it already was, I haven't been in such a small room since I visitied Manhattan, NYC. Our dresser was missing several pieces of hardware; the table and chairs provided in the room looked well-used - finish chipped, upholstery torn, chairs wobbly. The floor (carpet in most, tile in the bathroom area) was dirty, my feet got black just after a little while walking around barefoot. I had to use a piece of luggage as a bedside table. The inside of the dorm-sized fridge was cracked with insulation visible. The wifi was nonexistent. My husband finally took his laptop out to the car to pick up the signal; I just gave up and tried to read a book. The toilet-roll holder was mounted to a piece of plywood which was nailed to the wall. Same for the clothes-rod in the "closet". The shower curtain felt like it came from the dollar store. The room smelled musty; thank goodness I had a candle to burn to combat the oder. The a/c was completely inefficient. With that half-wall, the cold air couldn't circulate to the other side where the bed is, and we were too warm all night. We didn't go to the pool, because there were NO chairs there! The motel itself is set back from the highway, but it's a bit confusing to enter the parking lot. You have to first turn into a strip-mall, then go to the end of it as if you're driving around to the rear, then you finally come upon the motel itself. The continental breakfast? A joke! Two kinds of cereal in dispensers, white bread for toast, a communal bowl of margarine, and another communal bowl of jam. The coffee was more like hot water that had a brown crayon passed through it. The fruit was plastic! (Why bother even putting that out?) The juice was actually a juice-drink, probably was only an orange-flavored beverage like Kool-Aid, tsk, a real sin in Florida. And last but not least, there were only two chairs! I guess the other guests knew not to come! Definitely just a place to sleep, but no more for us, when 192 is lined with other places with similar prices. What I want to know is what kind of camera they used to take the pictures that are on the website and the brochure, because they make that place look good, purple paint notwithstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Always Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Melanie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August. When we checked in we were greeted with smiling faces. The motel is is little old... but we have come back almost everytime we go to Florida. It is a great motel for its value, and close to everything. We truly love the Magic Castle Inn and look forward to our next trip to Florida to vist them again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: rhona321
Reviews.Content: This is a basic motel. We booked 7 nights as we were on a basic budget. On arrival we realised that the hotel is painted pink/lilac. Bit worrying but the rooms are absolutely fine. We had a King size bed, a fridge and a microwave. No hairdryer but the room was exceptionally clean although there was a strange smell of disinfectant or air freshener. Staff were lovely and helpful. Pool is across the parking lot but we had it to oursleves as few guests use it. Continental breakfast is not good but you get what you pay for. We really enjoyed out time here. It is close to many restaurants and Disney World is a ten minute drive away. We paid £30 a night and it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “LITERALLY a roach motel”
Reviews.Author: NIYM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night because I saw good reviews for this place on trip advisor....First let me start off by saying, you get what you pay for. . The room had the most horrible musky smell and the AC was off so it was hot and muggy. The AC never worked well and the smell never left the room. Then I realized there is no security latch on the door (every hotel we have ever stayed at has a security latch). The manager said none of the rooms has one....Nice. I didn't sleep at all well that night. I pushed furniture up against the door because there is one lock that anyone can open the door with a key (basically anyone). There was no blow dryer in the room. Oh! I almost forgot to mention the dead cockroach in the room the size of a small cat. As I said, its really cheap so you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough if you don't want to waste your money”
Reviews.Author: stardustcross
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-May. I stayed there for a rate of $34.99 for the double beds. Basically it's your standard roadside motel... Things I liked: - fridge+ microwave allowed me to save money on some meals - Wal-mart super close by. Good for buying Disney souvenirs (cheapest and better than those "1.99 t-shirts" stores which have NOTHING for 1.99!) - very friendly staff and night manager especially, who helped me in advance for my late (past 12 am) arrival! (exception was one day staff who had ignored me when she was counting cash out of the till and was talking on the phone with her friend/family...but overall staff services is good! - close to lots of good places to eat, and 7-elevens, and is a really easy drive to Disney plus the airport - outdoor pool in the parking lot was fun and had lots of lounge chairs. but it had a lot of bugs, so we had to clean it ourselves first. Not so good things/things to be aware of - a little on the "musky" smell side. Fine if you don't have allergies. - get the hair dryer from the front desk. the first one I borrowed didn't work but I returned it for a working one. - internet is free; it isn't the greatest but it works... in certain rooms. Make sure you ask for a room where the signal is good if you have plans to go online. - there is a free continental breakfast from 7-9am but when I was there there was just toast, those tiny donuts, 2 types of cereal, milk, fake Orange Juice, coffee.... so it's fine if you just need a quick bite before heading out but boring if you are staying for more than a day. Seating area only has 4 chairs haha. Overall if you're not picky and you literally just need a bed and basic stuff, this place is fine. You will have to deal with potential issues with your room and relocate (I had: non-working Internet, a faulty door lock, both on separate days) but you can save a lot of money. Other motels/inns in the area cost about the same, maybe a bit more ($40-50). Personally I may check out other places though. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great find for the $$$'s”
Reviews.Author: Blondieacerider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2009. Booked a king room, lovely comfortable bed, clean room, Place was very quiet, pool was empty so i had it to myself for my afternoon swims. All in all a great base that is not too far out of the way for all that Orlando has to offer but just far enough away!! We would recommend this place to anyone wanting a base to sleep while site seeing, staff very helpful, maid service every day. Absolute bargain for the money it cost us.. Much nicer than the Howard Johnson on International Drive where we stayed in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value,clean and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Johnviking6
Reviews.Content: The motel rooms were clean and comfortable.The owner and staff will do all they can to accomodate you.The location is great,near everything and especially many good restaurants with great deals.Very cheap to eat around here.There is a helicopter attraction in front which passes over the hotel,but it did not bother us and it is a good deal worth trying especially if you never went in a helicopter.The only real negative was the internet was not strong and we had to sometimes go to the lobby for a good reception,but they are supossed to change the routers which were out because of a previous storm.Over all a great value,it's not the Hilton,but neither is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, comfy bed, refer, micro, pool, friendly staff !!”
Reviews.Author: alfa-one26
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 weeks on Disney vacation, good location, convienit parking, good pool. Comfy beads firm but with pillow top. Average breakfast but we did ok. A/C work good. Grilled on BBQ a couple of times, picnic tables a little low. Staff was friendly and helpfull. Used laundry once, has large washer / dryers. TV was clear with enough channels. WIFI worked good every day.

Reviews.Title: “The best affordable place”
Reviews.Author: cesaritomateos
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful family hotel !!!! I spent Christmas and New Year's there with my wife, my two nieces (11 years old), and our baby boy (11 months old). The hotel is nothing outstanding, but the PRICE, LOCATION, and SERVICE are absolutely a HUGE PLUS. The owner and his employees went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and happy. Since the moment I made the reservations by phone to our last day there, they treated us with so much friendliness and warmth. They put a crib in our room (NO EXTRA CHARGE). It was old but in good shape and our son totally loved it. We had a small room and we were tight in space, but we managed. After all, we were there to see Mickey Mouse at the parks, we never intended to spend time at the hotel. The room was almost perfect. The first room we tried, smelled weird and they switched us immediately to another with a better carpet. Besides, the bed was terrible, but once again, the owner immediately switch matresses... they did everything to please us. The pool looks clean. We did not try it just because the weather was too cold. But I'm sure in Spring or Summer you can jump there after visiting the parks to refresh yourself before going to bed. You need to cross the parking lot to get to the pool, that's kind of bizarre, but I think it's worth it. The location is wonderful. We were close enough to return to the room some days to take a nap before returning to the parks rested. it is right in the middle of this long street filled with restaurants and shops. Less than a block away you have a nice and cheap Chinese Buffet and a Cici's Pizza. They offer a simple breakfast (included in the price) with milk, fake-juice, cereals, bread, jelly, and coffee. More than enough to start our day and get going. One more time, the staff was so alert about anything we needed, and they kept cleaning the breakfast area every few minutes. You can eat in your room or in a small sitting area. We had a fridge and a microwave in the room. Very handy, we prepared sandwiches and had dinner there. If you want to save money in a big way, and you are ready to accept a frugal life for a few days, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU. If you have money to spend, or you're too picky, go somewhere else. You will not like this place. Even though it is so inexpensive, the owner manages to keep nasty people out. There are many families with children and the environment is really nice. There is a helicopter pad right in front... but we only saw one helicopter while we were there, and actually it was fun to see. I am planning to return to Walt Disney World in a couple of years and I will be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good cheap base”
Reviews.Author: MelGeelong
Reviews.Content: Found this little cheapie on the net and after reading the reviews decided to book. $40 a night for 3 of us including a reasonable breakfast was all we expected for our money and that is what we got. Plenty of cheap eating houses around this hotel. Bus stop straight outside the door to all theme parks and every thing else you could want. A tour desk is available at reception. A nice on site pool for cooling off which we used most days. Room was getting a little old and tired but clean enough. We used this hotel for a base to sleep for 10 nights while in the area doing all the theme parks, it was certainly adequate for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMermaiden
Reviews.Content: This one falls into the roach motel category. A clean one, but still in the motel 6, super 8 level. It was cheap, on the main drag in Kissimmee & the people running it were nice. The pool is clean but kinda detached from the motel (across the parking lot). We didn't use the play area so I can't really comment on that. Others have remarked about the lack of shampoo/conditioners, this is true, bring your own or get them from the drug store. The breakfast is bare basics...all we ever had was cereal & juice/orange drink? Overall if you're cash strapped it's a good place. Unlike some other cheapies there were no loud parties, parking lot drag races, or criminal activity. It was quiet and only other families occupied the place.

Reviews.Title: “no no no”
Reviews.Author: Karen1961
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Magic Castle. I booked it on the excellent reviews this place has been given. Check it out on Google Earth first! No-one mentions the Helicopter flights from beside the hotel or the go-cart racing clearly visible on the map. The furnature and rooms are old and stained and the carpet sticky but if you can see past that the staff do keep the place clean. Every day we had clean towels and sheets and the staff were all really helpful and friendly. However our room had ants, bedbugs and cockroaches. The location is great for Disney only 10 mins drive to Downtown where you can park for free and then use the disney buses to get to all the parks etc. The free shuttle ended over a year ago. The breakfast is what you would expect for a cheap motel but there are many excellent places within walking distance for food and a huge Walmart just a few mins drive or 15 mins walk away. You get what you pay for but I have stayed in many motels in the area for a similar price but of a much better standard. A member of staff told me that some of the reviews of the motel, on this site may not be genuine and if you stay there you will find out that could well be true. This area always has plenty of rooms available and as we walked along the road many places were advertising room for $10 less per night. Next time I will go and check out the place in person before I book.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in the kissimmee fl, area”
Reviews.Author: richie75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my employment at Disney World. The rooms were clean and the prices were low. I liked the idea that the shuttle bus stopped at the hotel, and it also was around all the other attractions, and shopping outlets. The staff was friendly and always on top of something if you need something. I would consider this hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find!!!”
Reviews.Author: FleurDeLis1222
Reviews.Content: This place was such a great surprise and it was only 5-10 minutes from the Disney parks- and 1 block down from a 24 hour CVS. The motel was in great condition and the pool area was very clean. Our towels were refreshed everyday & our room was very tidy. The continental breakfast only had coffee, orange juice, cereal, toast, and powdered donuts, but that was good enough for us. I also enjoyed having a fridge in our room- it was nice to come back to a cold bottle of water after a long day in Disney One huge plus: we didn't hear a peep from the surrounding rooms. The lady staying next to us even apologized for the "melt down" that her toddler had one night, but I told her that we hadn't heard a thing. One warning: bring your own soap and shampoo. They didn't leave any shampoo in our room and the soap that they give states that it is "Made in India" and made from "vegetable oil." It caused discomfort in some sensitive areas, so I bought our own from the CVS down the street.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: sarmientosurf
Reviews.Content: My name is Gerardo and I stayed there the month of June after spending some days in Boston. The breakfast is really good (mermelade, donuts differents size, butter, toast, milks, coffe) all very clean. These people made me feel so comfortable and welcomed you would be crazy to stay anywhere else. You are right acros many restaurants. You are walking distance to all shops. The room had microwave oven and fridge. The shampoo and soap were complementory and we paid $36. Nice pool too. A detail Jackie is cute & beatiful

Reviews.Title: “Happy 1st Trip To Florida”
Reviews.Author: txlady1947
Reviews.Content: Me And My Daughter ,Son In Law And Granddaughter Arrived There On Feb 23 We Were Given A Room Close To The Front Office So We Could Have Internet Access The Room Was Very Clean My Daughter,Son In Law And Granddaughter Then Went On The Disney Cruise I Was There For The Next 4 Days By Myself Every Day The Maid Came In And Cleaned The Room It Was A Quiet Place To Stay No Noise At All...I Was Very Impressed The Staff was Very Helpful.....We Left There On March 1 Headed Back Home To Texas ...If I Ever Go Back To Kissimmee I Would Stay There And I Would Recomend My Friends To Stay There ....Thanking You For My 1st Trip To Florida To Be A Very Pleasant Trip....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer1956
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Magic Castle late from the airport (the lights around the reception area made it easy to find in the dark!) - check in was very efficient and friendly. I had a problem with the key in my jeep and the lady behind reception came out and helped me. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I had asked for a room on an upper floor and that is what I got - Room 350. It is a mini king suite with a half wall dividing the sleeping area from the sitting area. The sitting area had a two seater couch which I think may have made into a bed , a standard lamp and coffee table. There was a long wooden piece of furntiure with drawers for clothes which had a large TV which could face either the sitting area or the bedroom area. I also had a fridge microwave and coffee maker. There was also a nice round table and two chairs. The swimming pool area was clean and the loungers comfortable. It was quite busy owing to the Daytona Beach Nascar event over the weekend but even with that I didnt notice any rowdy residents. As previous reviewers had mentioned the breakfast area is very small, however, as my room and I suspect most the rooms had a nice round table and two chairs it was nicer to eat in the room anyway - there was tea coffee (Caf and decaf) Orange Juice and lemonade - three types of cereal with milk - bread for the toaster and some sweet donuts etc. Location is also very good - the motel is between Marker 10 and 11 on HWY 192 - the Disney exit is Marker 6 - there was a 7 Eleven right next door and a Publix just before Marker 11. I also went for an Airboat ride which is at Boggy Creek which was just at the end of Ponciana (Ponciana was the intersection just at the corner. All in all would recommend it but having read some of the negative reviews - would remind readers that is is not 5 star - nor does it pretend to be - be realistic in your expectations and you wont be disappointed. For the price I paid I think it was great value for money, anyone I spoke to was friendly both staff and customers - all in all great value for the money and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly staff - Great value”
Reviews.Author: Shadohart
Reviews.Content: We spotted this hotel on one of our other trips (we go every couple of weeks) and I forgot about it till I found it again on this site. It's not the ritz, but it's a clean and decent room for a great value. We got the King mini suite and the room was huge. They have a fridge and microwave in every room... the TV was about 32 inches (certainly bigger than most places). This is an older motor lodge, but it appears to be well maintained. Don't let a the purple exterior turn you away!

Reviews.Title: “Don't confuse Jennifer with Jackie”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Motel hasn't changed too much over the past 10 years however updates are getting better. Please don't confuse wonderful Jennifer for rude Jackie. Linda

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: MickeyFan_MN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times at the Magic Castle at 5055 W. Irlo Bronson Highway for the last 6 years. Most of the reviews I saw were from 2005 and before. This motel has been on the upswing since then. They sold the other Magic Castle they owned and put the money into remodeling this one. New beds, new bathroom fixtures (in some rooms), and repaired/remodeled the elevator, etc. Unfortunately, the owner also painted it a purple color! It recently has changed owners again. The new owner has continued fixing up the place, the rooms, and again remodeled the inside of the elevator. He has really fixed up the lobby and the continental breakfast area. He has also put in pop/ice machines on all the 3 floors. I recently stayed there from Feb 11 to Feb 17, 2006 and paid $34.99/night. The next week I stayed at my nephew's time-share. But we again stayed at the Magic Castle on Sunday, February 26, 2006 for $39.99/night. The pictures on their website are accurate ones of the place. I found nothing wrong with my room. The bathroom was clean and the towels were sparkling white. Everything worked fine. My room this time and every time, I have stayed at the Magic Castle has always been more than suitable to eat in and very clean. The maid came in daily to clean and vacuum. Of course, I always tip the maids, as should everyone. If you look at the website pictures, you will see the breakfast area, which is quite nice and is on two long tables with another table holding the condiments, the paper plates, and plasticware. There also was an area for a couple to sit at and eat in the breakfast area but I found it much nicer to go back to my room to eat. There is a quiet pond on the west side of the motel and another quiet pond and street behind the motel. This keeps the place relatively quiet. A few times, guests have been louder than I like but this is when they are going into their rooms and the noise is short. I have been at more expensive motels and have the same type of noise. I feel that no matter where you stay, you will always find someone talking louder than they should. Magic Castle also has three convenient roads in which to drive to Walt Disney World - Highway 192, Osceola Parkway, and Highway 535. One of my pictures shows these roads. The pictures I have posted were taken before 2004 and before the remodeling. The pictures on the website show the new bedspreads and the new sink fixture. Not all rooms have this new sink fixture. I prefer the old ones that have a counter. To tell the truth,I would prefer that this motel be one of my "secrets" as I like this place a lot. Some people may have had an unfortunate experience but I can tell you I never had and I have been going there for many years.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific dump!”
Reviews.Author: helenvacation
Reviews.Content: We booked this place on the way down via the travel cupon book, and should have known better. The outside is horrific purple, which would probably appeal to children. The inside is another story. The rate quoated on the phone call 2 hours prior to our arrival was quite different than what we were charged. They were very accomodating about refunding us the difference. As in prior descriptions, the rooms are standard, small etc. The beds were so bad that one night, I slept on the floor. We asked for an extra pillow on the first night, and never saw it. The toilet and tub were clean, but the base of the tiolet, outside of the tub and inside of the bathroom door were covered in what appeared to be vomit from a previous guest. I brought this to the attention of the staff and they cleaned it up some what. The room smelled like wintergreen, the face of the A/C fell off the first night and was never changed, and the ice bag was never never replaced. Large patched areas on the walls, just makes the place look like a dump. Breakfast was standard fare, but served on a small card table with no place to eat. The rooms were not clean enough to eat in, so we ate in the parking lot. This is a below budget hotel. You can do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle was a haven compared to other hotels, especially with the low fares. My family was in a time of need and we were able to find a hotel with efficient and pleasant service and great rooms. My family fell in love with this fantabulous hotel. We are definitely going there for our vacation next time and for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the price. We stayed 1 night just to see Magic Kingdom. Breakfast was perfect. I stayed with 3 children under 13 and it was perfect. If you are just staying over - this is the place. The price was approx $25/night - it was exactly as expected.

Reviews.Title: “The Tragic Castle”
Reviews.Author: Denness
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Magic Castle aprox 4 years agao, I was looking forward to staying there with my wife, daughter and grandson. I prebooked 2 rooms before I left the U.K. in case they were full, as in the past, the rooms soon went due to the fact of it being a cheap but cheerful place to stay. We arrived at the end of April to be confronted by a Barnie purple building, what a disasterous colour, when previously it had been a pretty pink fairy type castle. We were given 2 rooms on the ground floor next door to one another, ours had an adjoining door to another room, where the smoke from there poured into ours, making sleeping a sickening experience. ( these were both non smoking rooms ) our daughter's room was located next to the elevator and she had to put up with it constanltly " dinging" and also no daylight due to the room being under the stairs. The noise of other guests during the night was unbearable, and was so bad that police were involved. We left for a quiet restful week on the Gulf coast, and then returned to the Magic Castle for the last 2 days before returning home. Thinking it couldn't be as bad as the previous stay, we had 2 more adjoining rooms on the 3rd floor, what a mistake, sound travels up!!!! the pool was in full use in the early hours of the morning of what seemed liked drunken kids ( where was the security ) Although the rooms were supposed to have all been renovated, ours certainly weren't, we were given a microwave with no available wall plug, so you had to lift it onto the dresser and unplug one of the light fittings. The bath was a disgrace with some really awfull looking stains, and the room itself was shabby. My daughters room was in the same shabby state with the TV cable socket hanging off the wall. The pool needs a complete renovation,all the concrete was patchy, cracked and dirty and the sun loungers ( all 3 of them ) needed to be put in the nearest garbage. I have always recommended The Magic Castle to friends in the past, all I can say is SORRY. We will not be going there again......EVER.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs bite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: horrible place to bring children.the rooms stink like god knows what. my son and family got bit by some strange bugs. you couldnt fit a volkswagon in the pool. there are drug addicts who live there but i bet they dont tell you that on the internet do they.big country lives there. some people have huge dogs in their rooms. please dont ruin your family vacation go somewhere else trust me. dan bridgeport ct.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: shersl84bed
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal, very economical. At first glance of the purple and yellow building we thought uh-oh! But it really was a pleasent surprise. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable. They gave us extra pillows when we called down. The carpet is a bit old but we have seen this at even more expensive hotels. It had grills and 3 picnic tables that we took advantage of during our stay. I will say they could use new picnic tables. Breakfast was always refilled so there wasnt a problem getting anything. They offered 3 cereals, two kinds of toast, donuts, bananas, 2 different juices, and coffee. We had the pool to ourselves on more than a few occasions. They have a little stream that goes by the picnic tables and grills that had a baby racoon fishing during the evenings. The hotel staff was very friendly. We would definately stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Magic Castle Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 5055 W. Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, U.S. 192, Kissimmee, FL 34746
